note: Espers and Mentalists both fall under the Esper lineage. Characters can be Esper, Mentalist, or both (Priority A).

description.short: You have an advantage on all Initiative rolls (roll 3d6, drop the lowest). Additionally, you are immune to the negative effects of fear from mundane sources (gunfire, intimidation) and have an advantage on rolls to resist supernatural fear.
description.player: You have a battle-honed mind. You instinctively perceive tactical patterns, remain calm under fire, and anticipate enemy actions with an unnerving prescience. This is not a conscious thought; it is an innate state of being in a high-stress environment.

description.short: You have innate, regenerating protection. You have a pool of 3 Shield Boxes. At the start of your turn, if you have taken damage to this pool, it regenerates 1 Shield Box. Incoming damage ticks off these Shield Boxes before affecting your Health/Stun tracks. This pool does not stack with the Sorcerer's Aegis Shield Move.
description.player: Your Aether-organ reacts to incoming threats, hardening your bio-field an instant before impact. This is not armor; it is a flicker of reactive, localized reality warping that dulls the force of a blow.

description.short: Push your body past its limits. On a 10+, gain +1 to all Esper power rolls for a minute. On a 7-9, you succeed but gain 1 Temporary Corruption. On a 6-, your powers fail for the next turn.
description.player: Push your body past its limits. On a 10+, gain +1 to all Esper power rolls for a minute. On a 7-9, you succeed but gain 1 Temporary Corruption. On a 6-, your powers fail for the next turn.

description.short: You push your Aether-organ to its limit, creating a momentary, localized warp.
description.player: You push your Aether-organ to its limit, creating a momentary, localized warp. You don't run; you simply cease to be in one place and arrive in another. 10+: You instantly move to any location you can see within a short distance (e.g., 50 feet). This movement does not provoke any reactionary attacks. 7-9: You make the jump successfully, but the biological strain is intense. You suffer 1 Stun damage, or the chaotic exit adds 1 DP to the Dissonance Pool. 6-: The warp is unstable. You arrive at a location near your intended target, but not precisely where you wanted, possibly leaving you in a poor tactical position.

description.short: You channel Aether into your legs, unleashing a single, impossibly powerful leap aimed at delivering a devastating blow.
description.player: You channel Aether into your legs, unleashing a single, impossibly powerful leap aimed at delivering a devastating blow. This is not for travel; it is a weaponized trajectory. 10+: Your leap is perfect. You can launch yourself from any surface and land adjacent to any target within a significant range (e.g., across a wide street, or from a rooftop down to the street). Your first melee attack upon landing automatically hits and deals +1 damage from the sheer force of the impact. 7-9: The landing is rough. Your attack still hits, but you suffer the "shaken" effect for a moment, taking a minor penalty on your next defensive roll as you recover your footing. 6-: You misjudge the arc. You land near your target but not in melee range, and the jarring impact means you cannot take an attack action this turn.

description.short: You have mastered supernatural mobility. You can run up walls for short distances, slide down sheer surfaces without harm, and leap across gaps that would be impossible for a normal athlete. You ignore all movement penalties from difficult or uneven terrain. This represents your character's new, fundamental relationship with their environment.
description.player: This is a passive state of grace. The Aether subtly cushions your falls, lightens your steps, and guides your hands and feet to impossible holds. Walls become temporary floors, and long falls are merely an opportunity to reposition.

description.short: Once per combat scene, you can perform a Flash Strike. You teleport to an enemy and make a melee attack as a single action. This attack is impossible to dodge or parry; it can only be soaked with armor.
description.player: You have mastered the offensive application of the Flash Step. Instead of re-orienting, you arrive from the warp with your weapon already in motion, giving your target no time to react.

description.short: When you successfully hit a target with your Pierce the Sky Move, the impact creates a concussive blast. All other characters (friend or foe) adjacent to your target are knocked off their feet and suffer 1 Stun damage.
description.player: An evolution of the Dragoon's signature attack. Your controlled descent is now so powerful that your landing creates a localized shockwave.

description.short: When there are no enemies within 5 feet of you at the start of your turn, your first melee attack that turn gains a +1 bonus to its roll.
description.player: You are at your most dangerous when you have room to maneuver. Your combat style is predicated on charges, lunges, and wide, sweeping attacks.

description.short: You designate one conveyance or creature as your Bonded Mount. This mount gains a rudimentary intelligence and loyalty to you. It can understand and follow your simple commands even when you are not physically present.
description.player: You perform a ritual (which may be as simple as laying hands on the mount's frame or looking a beast in the eye) to forge a permanent Aetheric bond with a single mount. This bond imbues the mount with a sliver of your own consciousness.

description.short: Once per day, you can summon your Bonded Mount. It will arrive at your location as quickly as it can reasonably travel. If it is a conveyance and is blocked (e.g., in a secured shed), it cannot reach you.
description.player: By calling out through your Aetheric bond, you can summon your mount to your location. For a conveyance, this might manifest as it driving itself to you from a nearby nearby; for a beast, it might travel across the city to find you.

description.short: You are a perfect rider. When you are on or in your Bonded Mount, you can perform any piloting or riding maneuver as if you were a master. This means you can drive a motorcar, fly a airship, or ride a beast with expert proficiency, even if you have never done so before. You gain an advantage on all rolls made to pilot or control your mount.
description.player: Your bond grants you an intuitive, supernatural understanding of how to operate your mount. This is not learned knowledge; it is pure instinct.

description.short: You do not suffer the normal penalties from exhaustion. You can continue to fight, run, or perform strenuous physical activity for hours without penalty. However, you are only deferring the cost. For every scene you use this ability, you must spend twice that amount of time in complete rest during the next Downtime before you can recover any Health or Stun damage. You can push your body to incredible limits, but the bill always comes due.
description.player: You activate a "sustained performance" technique within your Aether-organ. Your body's need for rest and recovery is deferred, allowing you to operate at peak physical capacity long after others would have collapsed from exhaustion. You are relentless.

description.short: You channel all of your Aetheric energy into a single, massive, all-or-nothing blow.
description.player: You channel all of your Aetheric energy into a single, massive, all-or-nothing blow. This is not a quick strike; it is a telegraphed, earth-shattering display of force, perfect for breaking down defenses or obliterating a stationary target. 10+: Your attack is overwhelming. Your next melee attack this turn automatically hits and deals +3 damage. 7-9: The blow is powerful but uncontrolled. The attack still hits and deals the bonus damage, but the wild exertion leaves you wide open. Your opponents have an advantage on their next attack roll against you. 6-: You over-commit to the swing, losing your balance and staggering. You miss your attack completely and cannot take a defensive action until your next turn.

description.short: Your baseline durability is increased. You gain a permanent +1 natural armor against both Wound and Blunt damage. This stacks with the protection from your Aetheric Defense Shield Boxes, making you incredibly tough to injure.
description.player: Your Aetheric Defense has become proactive rather than reactive. Your bio-field is now permanently hardened, creating a tangible, armor-like barrier that is always active.

description.short: When an adjacent ally you have designated as your ward is attacked, you can choose to have that attack target you instead. You can use your Aetheric Defense or a physical shield to block the blow as if you were the original target. You may only have one ward designated at a time. Changing your ward mid-scene requires a successful Willpower roll, representing a significant shift in your protective desire.
description.player: You designate a single ally as your "ward." This is a deep, instinctual choice that cannot be easily changed. Your Aether-organ now perceives threats to your ward as threats to yourself, allowing you to intercede with supernatural speed and certainty.

description.short: As your entire action for a turn, you enter a state of Full Defense. Until the start of your next turn, you double the effectiveness of your Aetheric Defense (e.g., it regenerates 2 boxes instead of 1) and your natural armor. You cannot take any offensive actions while in this state, but you are incredibly difficult to harm.
description.player: You forgo all pretense of offense, planting your feet and focusing every ounce of your Aetheric and physical being into becoming an immovable, impenetrable object. You are the eye of the storm.

description.short: When wielding a physical shield, you can make a melee attack with it. A successful shield bash deals significant Stun damage and has a chance to knock your opponent off balance, giving you an advantage on your next action against them.
description.player: You have mastered the art of turning your primary defensive tool into a brutal offensive weapon. Your shield is not just a barrier; it's a battering ram.

description.short: Your unarmed strikes are as deadly as any weapon, dealing significant Stun or Wound damage (player's choice).
description.player: Your unarmed strikes are as deadly as any weapon, dealing significant Stun or Wound damage (player's choice).

description.short: You gain a permanent +1 natural armor against Blunt damage.
description.player: You gain a permanent +1 natural armor against Blunt damage.

description.short: For one minute, your Tier of Effect for all Strength-based actions is increased by one.
description.player: For one minute, your Tier of Effect for all Strength-based actions is increased by one.

description.short: You can summon your one specific, bonded suit of armor onto your body instantly from any location.
description.player: You can summon your one specific, bonded suit of armor onto your body instantly from any location.

description.short: During Downtime, you can temporarily modify your armor, granting it a new, minor property for the next mission.
description.player: During Downtime, you can temporarily modify your armor, granting it a new, minor property for the next mission.

description.short: You are so attuned to your armor that you suffer none of the usual penalties for its weight or bulk.
description.player: You are so attuned to your armor that you suffer none of the usual penalties for its weight or bulk.

description.short: As part of a melee or ranged attack action, you can choose to go "All In." For that single attack, you gain a +2 bonus to your roll. However, your Aetheric Defense pool is completely depleted and cannot regenerate until the start of your next turn, leaving you vulnerable.
description.player: You deliberately drop your reactive Aetheric defenses, shunting that power directly into your offensive capabilities for a single, decisive attack.

description.short: As an action, you can assess a single opponent. The GM will tell you their general fighting style (e.g., brawler, martial artist, marksman) and their level of proficiency (Untrained, Trained, Expert, or Master) in their primary combat skill.
description.player: You use your Battle Cognition not just for awareness, but for analysis. By observing a target's stance, movements, and equipment, you can instantly get a read on their martial capabilities.

description.short: You are considered to have a Trained (0) skill level with every weapon, even those you have never seen before. You will never suffer an "untrained" penalty. Furthermore, if you decide to spend XP to increase your skill with a specific weapon, the cost to reach the Expert rank is halved.
description.player: Your Aether-organ grants you an intuitive, baseline understanding of any weapon you pick up. You instinctively know the proper grip, balance, and basic function of any tool designed for combat.

description.short: You can target an enemy who is behind partial cover (e.g., peeking around a corner, behind a crate). Your shot ignores the defensive bonus of that cover as the bullet curves in flight to find its mark.
description.player: You subtly manipulate the Aether around your bullet's trajectory, allowing it to curve around cover.

description.short: You can make a ranged attack against a target who is behind total cover, provided there is a viable surface to ricochet your shot off of. This attack is made at a penalty, but it allows you to hit the "unhittable."
description.player: You have a supernatural understanding of angles and ricochet potential. You can intentionally fire a bullet at a surface to strike an enemy who is completely out of your line of sight.

description.short: Once per scene, as a reaction when you are targeted by a single ranged firearm attack, you can attempt to block it. Make an opposed attack roll against your attacker. If you succeed, you shoot their bullet out of the air, negating the attack completely in a spectacular display of skill.
description.player: Your connection to your firearm is so absolute that you can perform the ultimate defensive feat: shooting a bullet out of the air.

description.short: At the start of any combat where you have not yet acted, you can choose to perform a First Strike. This allows you to interrupt the initiative order and immediately take your turn. Your first attack on this turn gains a +1 bonus. After this action, you rejoin the normal initiative order.
description.player: You have mastered the art of Iaijutsu—the single, lightning-fast draw and cut. You strike before your opponent has even registered the threat.

description.short: Once per scene, you can declare an Aetheric Strike. Your next melee attack ignores any defensive bonuses the target might have from cover or defensive stances (like a Shield Warden's Full Defense).
description.player: You channel your Aether into your blade, not to imbue it with an element, but to guide it along the most perfect, efficient path to its target, bypassing clumsy defenses.

description.short: When you attack an enemy who is stunned, knocked prone, or otherwise significantly disadvantaged (GM's discretion), you can declare a Final Strike. If the attack hits, it is automatically considered a Critical Hit.
description.player: You see the fatal opening. When your opponent is staggered, off-balance, or otherwise vulnerable, you can deliver a precise finishing blow.

description.short: You designate a single weapon as your Attuned Weapon. You can only have one at a time. This attunement is a prerequisite for your other abilities.
description.player: You perform a lengthy ritual during Downtime, forming a deep, Aetheric bond with one specific weapon of your choice. This weapon becomes your signature, your Excalibur.

description.short: When using your Attuned Weapon, you are always considered to have a Master (+2) skill rank, regardless of your actual trained skill level. This bonus does not apply to any other weapon.
description.player: Through your attunement, your skill with your chosen weapon has reached a level of supernatural mastery that transcends mere training.

description.short: Once per combat scene, you can activate your weapon's unique imbued power. Examples include:
description.player: You can channel your Aetheric power through your attuned weapon, unleashing a single, spectacular signature move. This effect should be personal and defined by the player in collaboration with the GM when they first attune the weapon.

description.short: You gain precise information about the target's health. You know their exact Health and Stun boxes, can detect any diseases or poisons, and identify the presence of mutations or bioware.
description.player: You place your hand on a living being and attune your Aether-organ to its biological rhythms, allowing you to instantly diagnose its physical state.

description.short: You can mend fresh wounds. Clear two ticked boxes from one location's Stun Track OR one boxfrom its Health Boxes. This can be used on yourself or a target you touch.
description.player: You channel raw Aether directly into a wounded living being, kickstarting its natural healing processes. This is battlefield medicine, quick and potent.

description.short: Over a period of minutes or even a scene, you can effectively treat one disease or poison affecting a target. On a successful roll, you either neutralize the poison, or halt the progression of a disease, allowing natural recovery to begin.
description.player: You perform a more focused and sustained application of Aetheric healing to combat chronic conditions, diseases, or poisons. This takes time and concentration.

description.short: You gain access to the target's complete genetic code, revealing predispositions, hidden flaws, or latent mutations. This also allows you to identify all their innate biological strengths and weaknesses, giving you deep insight into their physical nature.
description.player: You perform an incredibly detailed bioscan, not just of a being's current state, but of its fundamental biological pattern.

description.short: Over a period of Downtime and with appropriate materials (bioware, tissue samples), you can repair chronic conditions or remove congenital defects.
description.player: You can manipulate a creature's genetic structure to remove flaws or integrate new biological components.

description.short: You can install, maintain, and repair any Tier 1 or Tier 2 Bio-Mods on any willing or helpless subject.
description.player: Your expertise allows you to understand and work with basic and corporate-grade bioware.

description.short: You can create and install a new minor organ (e.g., a secondary liver, an enhanced optic nerve) or a cosmetic alteration (e.g., iridescent skin, bioluminescent eyes) in a living being. This is a complex, time-consuming procedure.
description.player: You can sculpt and integrate new organs or tissues from raw Aether and genetic material, creating entirely new biological systems within a living being.

description.short: You can enhance the synergy between two existing biological features in a target (e.g., making their muscle strength work better with their bone density). This grants a bonus (e.g., +1) to relevant rolls.
description.player: Your understanding of biological systems is so profound that you can identify and enhance the natural interoperability of existing traits.

description.short: You can install, maintain, and repair Tier 3 Bio-Mods.
description.player: Your expertise extends to the most advanced and dangerous bioware.

description.short: As long as you are not actively using your Esper powers, you are undetectable as an Esper. You appear to all forms of magical and psychic detection as a normal, non-powered human.
description.player: You have learned to instinctively suppress your own Aetheric signature, cloaking your nature from other sensitives.

description.short: You can automatically sense the presence of other Espers who are not using Aetheric Masking. Furthermore, you can make a Perception roll to detect a "Spark"—a non-powered individual with the latent potential to become an Esper.
description.player: You can attune your senses to detect the subtle Aetheric hum of a latent or active Cortex in others.

description.short: This is the Waker's most coveted and feared ability.
description.player: This is the Waker's most coveted and feared ability. You can perform a difficult and dangerous ritual to forcibly activate a latent Esper's Cortex, pushing them through a traumatic, accelerated evolution into a full-fledged Esper. 10+: The awakening is clean. The target awakens to their new powers, gaining their chosen Archetype. 7-9: The awakening is traumatic. The target awakens, but the psychic shock of the forced evolution inflicts 1 Permanent Corruption upon them. 6-: The procedure fails catastrophically. The Spark's potential is burned out forever, rendering them unable to ever become an Esper, and the psychic backlash inflicts 2 Stun damage on both you and the target.

description.short: You can touch a seed or small plant and cause it to grow to its full maturity in a matter of minutes. You could cause vines to rapidly snake up a wall to create a ladder, or cause thorny bushes to instantly erupt from the ground to form a barrier.
description.player: You channel life-giving Aether into a plant, dramatically accelerating its growth cycle.

description.short: You can touch a diseased or damaged plant and restore it to health. This can be used to neutralize blights, cure infections, or even mend physical damage to ancient, important trees.
description.player: You use your healing abilities to mend damage to plants or purge them of disease and corruption.

description.short: You are considered to have an Expert (+1) skill rank in Science (Botany) or a similar knowledge skill. You can identify any plant, know its properties (poisonous, edible, medicinal), and understand what it needs to thrive.
description.player: You possess an intuitive, encyclopedic knowledge of plant life. You understand soil composition, nutrient requirements, and the fundamental biology of any plant you encounter.

description.short: You can touch a fruiting or flowering plant and cause it to produce a massive, bumper crop, far exceeding its natural output.
description.player: You can touch a fruiting or flowering plant and cause it to produce a massive, bumper crop, far exceeding its natural output.

description.short: You can imbue a plant with unnatural durability, making wood as hard as steel, fibers as strong as cable, or bark as tough as armor plating.
description.player: You can imbue a plant with unnatural durability, making wood as hard as steel, fibers as strong as cable, or bark as tough as armor plating.

description.short: You can perform a form of plant 'gene-splicing,' taking a single, simple trait from one plant and grafting it onto another.
description.player: You can perform a form of plant 'gene-splicing,' taking a single, simple trait from one plant and grafting it onto another.

description.short: Your own body has adapted. You are highly resistant to the toxic and corrupting effects of the Blight.
description.player: Your own body has adapted. You are highly resistant to the toxic and corrupting effects of the Blight.

description.short: You can take a normal plant and infuse it with the Blight's corrupting energy, forcing grotesque but useful mutations: pitcher plants that drip acid, vines that constrict with unnatural strength, or flowers that release hallucinogenic pollen.
description.player: You can take a normal plant and infuse it with the Blight's corrupting energy, forcing grotesque but useful mutations: pitcher plants that drip acid, vines that constrict with unnatural strength, or flowers that release hallucinogenic pollen.

description.short: You can enhance the growth and spread of existing Blighted flora, causing it to rapidly overgrow an area.
description.player: You can enhance the growth and spread of existing Blighted flora, causing it to rapidly overgrow an area.

description.short: Your Triage and Treatment Moves are exceptionally effective when used on animals or Chimeras. When healing them, you can choose to clear one additional Stun box or automatically succeed on a Treatment roll without needing to roll the dice.
description.player: You have specialized your healing arts to work on the complex and often unstable biology of Chimeras and other animalistic creatures.

description.short: Animals will not willingly attack you unless you or an ally act aggressively toward them first. You have an advantage on all Social rolls made to calm, tame, or interact with animals.
description.player: You passively emit a complex series of pheromones that are calming to non-human animals. They instinctively recognize you as a non-threatening, even comforting, presence.

description.short: You are considered to have an Expert (+1) skill rank in Science (Zoology). You can identify any creature, understand its likely behaviors, and know its strengths and weaknesses.
description.player: You possess an encyclopedic, intuitive knowledge of the animal kingdom, from the most mundane pests to the most bizarre Blight-mutated predators.

description.short: When you are solely observing and not interacting, animals and non-sentient creatures are completely unaware of your presence. You have a massive advantage on any stealth rolls made to avoid detection by animals.
description.player: You can instinctively dampen your Aetheric signature and muffle your physical presence when observing wildlife.

description.short: You can now use your Bioscan Move on any target within 15 feet of you.
description.player: You have learned to perform your Bioscan from a short distance, allowing you to gather information without needing to risk physical contact with a dangerous creature.

description.short: As an action, you can open your senses to energy. The GM will describe the significant energy sources in your immediate vicinity, allowing you to spot active electronics, hidden power conduits, or active magical wards.
description.player: You can attune your senses to perceive the flow of energy around you. This includes electrical currents in the walls, the heat signature of a living being, or the Aetheric glow of a magical effect.

description.short: Once per scene, you can study a situation or an opponent and ask the GM for the "pattern." The GM will reveal a single, exploitable pattern (e.g., "The guard's patrol route has a consistent blind spot," "This opponent always telegraphs their heavy attack with a slight dip of their left shoulder").
description.player: Your mind is naturally inclined to see the patterns in all things, from the trajectory of a ricocheting bullet to the subtle tells in a person's speech or the flaw in a structural support.

description.short: You can target a single, simple electronic device (an electrical switch, a radio, a light) and cause it to temporarily malfunction, or you can attempt to disrupt a sustained magical effect, causing it to flicker or weaken for a moment.
description.player: By creating a small, dissonant pulse of Aether, you can interfere with a targeted energy pattern.

description.short: You have a perfect sense of range. You never suffer penalties for misjudging the distance for a thrown weapon, a leap, or a ranged attack. You instinctively know if a target is 10 feet away or 11.
description.player: You possess a perfect, intuitive sense of distance, dimension, and relation. Your mind is a three-dimensional map of your immediate surroundings.

description.short: This is the "never play pool against them" augment. You can perform impossible trick shots with thrown objects or ranged weapons, bouncing them off walls to strike targets behind cover. This functions similarly to the Gun Saint's Bounce It move, but can be applied to any projectile.
description.player: Your understanding of angles and trajectories is supernatural. You can calculate the precise path an object will take after bouncing off one or multiple surfaces.

description.short: You can use your knowledge of patterns to find the perfect path. You can move through any complex or difficult terrain (a dense forest, a rubble-strewn street, a crowded ballroom) at your full speed without penalty, flowing through the environment like water.
description.player: You see the "weave" of the environment, allowing you to move across it with uncanny efficiency.

description.short: Once per scene, when an attack would kill you or inflict a maiming injury, you may choose to "flicker." You instantly teleport a few feet to an adjacent safe location, causing the attack to miss completely.
description.player: Your Aether-organ is hardwired to your survival instinct. When faced with overwhelming harm, it will instinctively fold space to move you out of the way.

description.short: You gain telescopic vision, allowing you to see with perfect clarity at extreme distances and ignoring range penalties for Perception checks.
description.player: You can manipulate the space between your eyes and a distant object, effectively creating a "zoom lens" out of thin air.

description.short: You can instantly teleport to any location you can see within a significant range (e.g., up to 500m). This requires concentration and cannot be done as a purely reflexive action.
description.player: You have learned to consciously control your flicker, allowing you to instantly traverse any space you can see.

description.short: When you would be damaged by a source of electricity (a faulty power conduit, a stunning device), you can make a roll to absorb it. On a success, you take no damage and gain a "Charge."
description.player: You can safely absorb a significant amount of electrical energy into your body, storing it for later use.

description.short: By expending a Charge, you can choose to automatically win an Initiative roll, going first. Alternatively, you can expend a Charge to gain a significant bonus to a single Agility-based defense roll.
description.player: You can spend a stored "Charge" to flood your nervous system with bio-electricity, granting you a short burst of incredible speed and reaction time.

description.short: By expending a Charge, you may take one additional Move action on your turn.
description.player: You expend a Charge to Surge your entire system, allowing you to move with unnatural celerity.

description.short: Your timing is impeccable. You have an advantage on all rolls where precise timing is the most critical factor (e.g., disarming a bomb, hitting a switch at the exact right moment, synchronized actions with an ally).
description.player: You have a flawless internal chronometer. You know the exact time down to the microsecond, can perfectly measure elapsed time, and have an intuitive sense of rhythm and tempo.

description.short: At the GM's discretion, or once per session at a dramatic moment, you receive a cryptic, one-sentence vision of the future (e.g., "The gun misfires," "The floor gives way," "He's lying"). You have no control over what you see or when you see it.
description.player: Your mind is constantly brushing against the threads of the future. Occasionally, you get a flash of foresight, a brief, contextless vision of a future event.

description.short: After observing an opponent for one round, you can make a Predictive Analysis roll. On a success, the GM will tell you the most likely action your opponent will take on their next turn.
description.player: You take your Pattern Recognition to the next level. You don't just see what an opponent isdoing; you see what they will do next based on their established patterns.

description.short: Once per session, you can draw upon the Dissonance Pool's chaotic energy. The more DP in the pool, the greater the minor, positive coincidence you can create for yourself.
description.player: Once per session, you can draw upon the Dissonance Pool's chaotic energy. The more DP in the pool, the greater the minor, positive coincidence you can create for yourself.

description.short: You can choose to deliberately fail a roll or accept a major complication. When you do, you may add 2 DP directly to the Dissonance Pool.
description.player: You can choose to deliberately fail a roll or accept a major complication. When you do, you may add 2 DP directly to the Dissonance Pool.

description.short: When an opponent has a clear advantage, you can activate this move to 'even the odds.' For the next exchange, that opponent loses their advantage entirely.
description.player: When an opponent has a clear advantage, you can activate this move to 'even the odds.' For the next exchange, that opponent loses their advantage entirely.

description.short: You bear a physical mark that visibly darkens or grows more complex each time you place a Hex.
description.player: You bear a physical mark that visibly darkens or grows more complex each time you place a Hex.

description.short: You can touch a target and place a Hex upon them. The next time that target attempts a critical, important action, their roll automatically fails in a disastrous way. Once triggered, your Curse Mark recedes slightly.
description.player: You can touch a target and place a Hex upon them. The next time that target attempts a critical, important action, their roll automatically fails in a disastrous way. Once triggered, your Curse Mark recedes slightly.

description.short: If you are killed, all the stored energy in your Curse Mark is violently discharged. The person who killed you is immediately afflicted with a powerful Hex that triggers at the worst possible moment.
description.player: If you are killed, all the stored energy in your Curse Mark is violently discharged. The person who killed you is immediately afflicted with a powerful Hex that triggers at the worst possible moment.

description.short: Unless you deliberately draw attention to yourself, you are easily overlooked. You have an advantage on any roll made to blend in, go unnoticed in a crowd, or be forgotten by witnesses. People's memories of you are hazy and indistinct.
description.player: You have a unique Aetheric "non-presence." You are remarkably unremarkable, blending into any group or social setting with supernatural ease.

description.short: Once per story arc, you can tell the GM you are "following the feeling." The GM will then narrate how you end up in a location or situation that is, or will soon become, critically important to the current plot, even if you had no logical reason to go there.
description.player: You are guided by an uncanny instinct, a "gut feeling" that tells you where you need to be.

description.short: After a major event has occurred in a scene you are present for (a car wreck, an assassination, a negotiation), you can make a Pattern Recognition roll to notice one critical detail that is not immediately obvious (the model of the getaway car, the expensive coat on the bureaucrat, the slight tremor in the killer's hand).
description.player: Because you are always where things happen, you have developed a supernatural eye for the small, crucial details that others miss in the heat of the moment.

description.short: Your visions and prophecies almost always pertain to events that will occur within the next year, and often much sooner. The magnitude of the event determines how far out you see it; a personal betrayal might appear a week in advance, while a city-shaking conspiracy might cast its shadow a year ahead of time.
description.player: Your visions are focused on events that are relatively close, temporally speaking. You see the ripples, not the distant tidal waves.

description.short: When you use your Fleeting Glimpses ability, the GM will describe the vision not as a direct event, but as a series of 2-3 symbolic images (e.g., "A cracked porcelain mask, a wilting white rose, and a key turning in a rusted lock"). It is up to you, the player, to interpret their meaning.
description.player: When you attempt to look into the future, you receive your visions as a series of powerful, symbolic images, like a tarot reading.

description.short: When you receive a new vision, you can ask the GM if it "resonates" with any previous vision you have had. If there is a causal or thematic link between the two events, the GM will confirm it, allowing you to start piecing together the larger puzzle of coming events.
description.player: You have learned to see the thematic threads that connect your disparate visions.

description.short: Once per scene, you can look at a target (a person, a machine, a plan) and ask the GM for its "corrupting truth." The GM will tell you a single, hidden flaw, secret desire, or repressed vice that can be exploited (e.g., "The guard captain is secretly a gambling addict," "This machine has a critical design flaw in its cooling system that no one knows about," "The leader's 'noble' plan is secretly motivated by deep-seated jealousy").
description.player: You have taken a bite of the proverbial apple. You now perceive the world through a lens of duality and corruption, allowing you to see the inherent flaws and potential for chaos in any person, object, or system.

description.short: You gain a bonus to all defensive rolls made to dodge or parry. Your movements are jerky, unpredictable, and difficult to track, making you a frustrating and slippery opponent.
description.player: You instinctively move against the rhythm of your opponents, disrupting their flow and creating openings through sheer, calculated awkwardness.

description.short: You can target a 20-foot area. For the rest of the scene, all technology within that area becomes unreliable—lights flicker, audio becomes garbled with static, and any rolls made to operate complex machinery are at a penalty.
description.player: An evolution of Disrupt Energy. You can now create a persistent field of Aetheric static in an area.

description.short: You have a perfect, 360-degree 'sonar' sense, allowing you to perceive the exact location of any object or person that is making even the slightest noise.
description.player: You have a perfect, 360-degree 'sonar' sense, allowing you to perceive the exact location of any object or person that is making even the slightest noise.

description.short: You can attune your voice to the resonant frequency of a single, non-living object and unleash a focused cry. On a successful roll, the object cracks or shatters.
description.player: You can attune your voice to the resonant frequency of a single, non-living object and unleash a focused cry. On a successful roll, the object cracks or shatters.

description.short: You unleash a scream tuned to the frequency of living tissue. A single target you can see must make a difficult Physique roll or take significant direct Wound damage. Using this power is agonizing, and you also suffer 1 point of Wound damage.

description.short: When you are solely observing and not interacting, animals and non-sentient creatures are completely unaware of your presence. You have a massive advantage on any stealth rolls made to avoid detection by animals.
description.player: You can instinctively dampen your Aetheric signature and muffle your physical presence when observing wildlife.

description.short: As an action, you can deepen all the shadows in your immediate area, creating patches of supernatural darkness and reducing visibility for everyone.

description.short: While you are in dim light or darkness, your form becomes blurred and indistinct. Any attack made against you suffers a penalty.

description.short: You can automatically sense the presence of active Void magic, portals to the Void, and creatures deeply corrupted by its influence.
description.player: You can sense the "gaps" in reality, the places where the Void touches the world.

description.short: You can make a roll to bypass a single magical ward or barrier. On a success, you pass through it unharmed, leaving it intact behind you.
description.player: You can temporarily attune a magical ward or barrier to the frequency of the Void, causing a momentary "hole" in its defense that you can slip through.

description.short: You can instantly destroy any simple, non-permanent magical rune you can touch.
description.player: You can touch a simple runic inscription and flood it with chaotic Void energy, causing the structured magic to collapse.

description.short: Your connection to the Void is so strong that your mere presence destabilizes magic. Enchanted items temporarily lose their magical properties while you are holding them.

description.short: An evolution of Rune Breaker. You can now unravel complex, powerful, and permanent magical arrays with a touch.

description.short: You don't just cancel a spell; you consume it, drawing its power into the Void. This move allows you to automatically negate a single spell targeted at you.

description.short: Your body is partially phased with the Void. You gain a universal armor value against ALL forms of damage as a portion of all incoming energy simply ceases to exist upon contact.

description.short: Your existence is a lit fuse. Every time you channel the ultimate power of the Void, a piece of your own existence is permanently erased. You have a finite number of uses of your Void Blade ability before your own soul is completely negated.

description.short: You can automatically sense the presence and general direction of any significant, free-willed supernatural entity in your immediate vicinity (e.g., within the same large building or down the street). This is most commonly used to detect the terrifying presence of a Wraith, but can also sense powerful spirits or other unique Aetheric beings. This does not allow you to see the entity or know its specific nature, only that something powerful and "other" is nearby.
description.player: You can attune your senses to the Aether, allowing you to detect the presence of organized, independent consciousness nearby. This is a constant, low-level awareness, a "sixth sense" for the supernatural.

description.short: You can focus on a specific location or object, opening your mind to the psychic residue left behind by moments of intense emotion.
description.player: You can focus on a specific location or object, opening your mind to the psychic residue left behind by moments of intense emotion. You get a single, muddled sensory input (the smell of ozone, the feeling of being watched) without the context of the full event. 6-: You connect to a meaningless or misleading psychic echo, learning nothing of value.

description.short: At character creation, you define three types of Sprites you are attuned to. Each Sprite has a single, simple function it can perform. Examples include:
description.player: You can reach into the raw stuff of the Aether and give form and purpose to the simplest of "spirits"—the Sprites. These are not true intelligences, but more like simple patterns, basic imperatives you can command.

description.short: Designate one of your Sprites as your "Bonded Sprite." This Sprite is now a permanent companion. It is more intelligent, can follow more complex commands, and can manifest physically without requiring a separate action. However, this bond creates a vulnerability; if your Bonded Sprite is destroyed, you suffer 1 Stun damage from the psychic feedback.
description.player: You select one of your known Sprite types and form a deep, personal bond with it, sharing a fraction of your own consciousness to enhance its capabilities.

description.short: You can temporarily imbue a simple, mundane object (a chair, a statue, a pile of rubble) with a rudimentary animating spirit of your own creation.
description.player: You can temporarily imbue a simple, mundane object (a chair, a statue, a pile of rubble) with a rudimentary animating spirit of your own creation. 10+: The object animates and will follow one simple, ongoing command for the scene (e.g., "Guard this doorway," "Attack anyone who comes near me"). 7-9: The animation is flawed. It only lasts for a few minutes, or it follows your command too literally, causing unintended complications. 6-: The animating force is unstable. The object shudders and moves, but not in a useful way, and then falls inert.

description.short: When you use Animate the Inanimate, you can now give your construct a conditional command (e.g., "If someone opens that door, then attack them." "If I say the word 'danger,' then create a distraction.").
description.player: You have learned the basics of Aetheric "inscribing with purpose." You can now imbue your animated servants with simple IF-THEN logic.

description.short: While piloting a construct, you perceive everything it senses. You can control it with perfect precision, using your own skills for its actions. description.player: You project your consciousness into one of your active animated constructs, seeing through its "eyes" and controlling its every move directly.

description.short: You flood your construct with an overwhelming amount of your own mental energy, pushing its physical form past its design limits for a short burst of incredible performance. At the end of the effect, the construct suffers significant, lasting damage.

description.player: You can split your consciousness, animating and directing a number of simple constructs simultaneously. Each puppet acts as a node, sharing the perceiving load and allowing for complex, coordinated action.

description.short: Your horde of puppets acts with uncanny coordination, relaying sensor data to each other and working together on complex tasks without your direct input.

description.short: You can modify your puppets. A "bearer" puppet might be reinforced to carry heavy loads. A "hitter" puppet might have its hands replaced with weighted clubs. A "distraction" puppet might be filled with noisy junk. This allows you to customize your horde for the mission at hand.
description.player: You have learned to shape your constructs for specific roles. During Downtime, you can modify your inanimate puppets to better suit a task.

description.short: You can automatically sense the location and number of any intact dead bodies within a significant radius.
description.player: Your Spirit Sense is now attuned to the specific resonance of death. You can feel the presence of corpses nearby.

description.short: You can animate a large number of corpses, creating a horde of shambling, witless undead who will follow your simple commands.
description.player: An evolution of Master of Puppets, this allows you to raise and command a large number of undead servants at once.

description.short: Your horde acts as a single, coordinated entity. You can give them complex conditional commands, and they will execute them with mindless, relentless efficiency.
description.player: You have absolute control over your undead legion.

description.player: You can initiate a formal, binding negotiation with a spirit to convince it to inhabit a vessel you have prepared.

description.short: You can understand and speak the "language" of spirits. You can hold complex, nuanced conversations, perceive their true intent (though they can still lie with words), and have an advantage on all rolls made to negotiate with or understand a spiritual entity.
description.player: Your Aether-organ acts as a universal translator for spiritual consciousness, allowing for clearer and more intuitive communication than a sorcerer could ever achieve.

description.short: You can allow a spirit to inhabit your body for a scene. While channeling, the spirit can speak using your voice and see through your eyes. description.short: You can successfully create vessels for and forge pacts with spirits of a low power tier.
description.player: You have the knowledge and personal Aetheric strength to prepare vessels capable of housing common, lesser spirits.

description.short: You gain a permanent bonus to all Social rolls made when negotiating a Spirit Pact. It is very difficult to lose this favor unless you are caught repeatedly breaking the spirit of your agreements.
description.player: Your reputation precedes you. You are known as a master vessel-crafter and an honest broker, and spirits are inherently more disposed to deal with you favorably.

description.short: You can now create vessels for and forge pacts with spirits of a medium power tier.
description.player: Your skill has grown immensely. You can now prepare vessels of exquisite quality, capable of containing more powerful and influential spirits.

description.short: By spending a few minutes in concentration, you can create a temporary "domain" that is highly receptive to a specific spirit or type of spirit. description.player: You can temporarily attune an area's Aetheric resonance to match that of a specific spirit you are trying to summon or bargain with.

description.short: You have a mental list of spirits you can potentially contact. When a client needs a specific service (enforcement, information, protection), you can make a Lore roll to know which spirit in your Index would be the best fit for the job.
description.player: You maintain a "mental archive" of spirits you have knowledge of, categorized by their nature, domain, and the services they are likely to provide.

description.short: You can draft an Aetheric Contract. This is a physical or psychic document that, once agreed upon by two or more parties (at least one of which must be a spirit), is magically absolute. You have perfect recall of every contract you have ever drafted.
description.player: You are the architect of the magical agreement. You know the precise language, symbols, and Aetheric structures needed to create a contract that is intelligible and binding to both a mortal and a spirit.

description.short: You can add a "Soul Brand" clause to your Aetheric Contract. This creates a one-way or two-way connection between the signatories, allowing them to feel each other's general emotional state, send a simple one-word message, or know when the other has fulfilled (or broken) their part of the bargain.
description.player: As part of the contract, you can weave a minor sympathetic link between the signing parties. This is a spiritual "handshake" that creates a conduit for communication or fulfillment.

description.short: You can summon a number of Psychomata at once. At this stage, they are amorphous and their nature is determined by your current emotional state (as determined by the GM or player). They are not under your direct control and will act according to their core emotion (fearful summons will hide or cause panic, angry summons will attack indiscriminately, etc.).
description.player: You open a floodgate to your subconscious, letting loose a legion of your inner beings into the world.

description.short: As an action, you can give a single, one-word command (e.g., "Attack," "Flee," "Protect") to all of your active Psychomata. They will obey this command for one round before reverting to their instinctual behavior.
description.player: You can briefly exert your conscious will over your unruly subconscious creations, forcing them toward a single purpose.

description.short: This is a powerful, passive thematic effect. When your Psychomata are active, the immediate environment changes. A summon born of fear might cause shadows to deepen and strange whispers to echo. A summon born of joy might cause colors to become oversaturated and the air to feel warm. This provides a narrative bonus or penalty to social interactions in the area, depending on the mood.
description.player: When you summon your Psychomata, reality itself thins around you, taking on a surreal, dreamlike quality that reflects the nature of your summoned entity.

description.short: Your Waking Dream effect is now permanently twisted. The world around you becomes a terrifying tableau of your inner horrors. You gain an advantage on all Intimidation rolls.

description.short: When you summon your Lucid Legion, you can choose to summon one specific, more powerful "officer" from your Mythos instead of a group of lesser ones. This officer will have a unique ability related to its role in your personal story.
description.player: You can reach into your personal Mythos and pull out a more specialized entity suited for the current situation.

description.short: You can summon a large horde of your lesser Mythos creatures at once, creating a chaotic but impressive fighting force.
description.player: You can fully open the gates to your inner world, letting your Mythos spill into reality.

description.short: For the duration of a scene, you and your linked partner can communicate freely and instantly, thought-to-thought. description.player: You forge a direct, intimate psychic link with one other willing individual.

description.short: You can automatically sense the presence and approximate number of sentient minds in your immediate vicinity (e.g., within the same large building), even through walls. You cannot read their thoughts, only know that they are there.
description.player: Your Aether-organ is constantly scanning for the "signal" of other thinking minds.

description.short: You and your bonded partner are now permanently linked. You are always aware of each other's general status, no matter the distance. This permanent bond is a prerequisite for your other abilities.

description.short: As an action, you can make a roll to either absorb a negative emotional state (like fear or rage) from your partner onto yourself, or grant them a positive emotional state you are feeling (like calm or determination), giving them an advantage on their next relevant roll.
description.player: You can intentionally push or pull emotional states across your bond, steadying your partner's nerves or drawing on their courage.

description.short: Whenever you and your bonded partner perform a coordinated action against the same target (e.g., you both attack the same enemy, you create a distraction while they pick a lock), you both gain a significant bonus (+2) to your rolls.
description.player: Your actions and your partner's actions are now so perfectly in sync that you move as one.

description.short: You can see, hear, taste, and smell everything your host experiences. You have no control over their actions; you are simply along for the ride.
description.player: You can project your consciousness into a target you can touch, becoming a passive observer within their mind.

description.short: When you use Borrow Senses, your target is completely unaware of your presence unless they are a powerful telepath or have specific anti-intrusion defenses.
description.player: You have learned to muffle your psychic presence, making it incredibly difficult for even other meta-humans to detect your mental passenger.

description.short: While you are a passenger in a host, if they make physical contact with another person, you can make a roll to instantly transfer your consciousness from your current host to the new one.

sentinel.name: Sentinel
sentinel.description: The Sentinel is a living fortress, an Esper whose Aether-organ is fundamentally attuned to the realities of combat. They perceive the battlefield not as chaos, but as a flow of information to be understood and acted upon. Their power is reactive, intuitive, and focused on control and survival. This is the baseline from which all Sentinel specializations evolve.

dragoon.name: Dragoon
dragoon.description: Mobility. The Dragoon redefines their relationship with the battlefield, treating it not as a static grid but as a three-dimensional space to be crossed in an instant. They are masters of the sudden strike and the impossible repositioning.

lancer.name: Lancer
lancer.description: The Lancer has honed the Dragoon's mobility into a single purpose: the perfect, unstoppable charge. They treat their own body as the ultimate spearhead, a living projectile meant to shatter enemy lines. This path is defined by a focus on large, two-handed melee weapons (spears, greatswords, polearms).

rider.name: Rider
rider.description: The Rider extends their sense of mobility beyond their own body, forming a deep, supernatural bond with a mount. Whether it's a motorized cycle, a skycraft, a horse, or a captured Sand Drake, the Rider and mount become a single, synergistic entity.

juggernaut.name: Juggernaut
juggernaut.description: Defense through inexorable force. The Juggernaut abandons tactical finesse in favor of becoming an unstoppable, unbreakable wall of flesh and Aether. They are the anchor point of a battle, weathering blows that would fell lesser beings and delivering single, telegraphed, but utterly devastating attacks. Their power is not about speed; it's about momentum.

shield-warden.name: Shield Warden
shield-warden.description: Protection above all. The Shield Warden has taken the Juggernaut's unbreakable nature and turned it outward. They are not just a wall; they are a sanctuary. Their existence is defined by the absolute, unwavering defense of a chosen ward. They are the ultimate bodyguard, a living shield for another.

brute.name: Brute
brute.description: Flesh is the ultimate weapon. The Brute has eschewed complex defenses and weaponry in favor of perfecting their own body into an instrument of overwhelming physical force. They are masters of the brawl, turning their fists into hammers and their skin into steel.

knight.name: Knight
knight.description: My armor is my second skin. The Knight has embraced the ideal of the armored warrior, using their Aether to summon, modify, and master a signature suit of armor. They are a walking fortress, a perfect union of person and plate.

knightmare.name: Knightmare
knightmare.description: Fear is a weapon. The Knightmare has embraced the terrifying, monstrous aspects of their power. They are no longer just a warrior; they are a walking horror story, a slaughter machine that feeds on the terror it creates. This is a path of trauma and darkness.

battle-saint.name: Battle Saint
battle-saint.description: The best defense is a relentless offense. The Battle Saint has repurposed their defensive Aetheric abilities into tools for aggression and analysis. They are not concerned with enduring the fight; they are focused on ending it. They are students of violence in all its forms.

weapon-saint.name: Weapon Saint
weapon-saint.description: This is not a generalist path; it is the path of the ultimate specialist. The Weapon Saint has chosen to pour their entire martial identity into a single, signature weapon, becoming so attuned to it that the weapon is no longer a tool but an extension of their soul.

sword-saint.name: Sword Saint
sword-saint.description: The perfect strike. The Sword Saint's art is one of lethal minimalism. They do not waste movement or energy. Every action is dedicated to creating the single, perfect opportunity to end the fight with one clean, decisive blow. They are masters of anticipation, timing, and killing intent.

blade-dancer.name: Blade Dancer
blade-dancer.description: Combat is a performance. The Blade Dancer flows through battle like water, a whirlwind of constant, fluid motion. They turn defense into offense and offense into a seamless, beautiful, and deadly dance. To fight them is to be drawn into their rhythm, a rhythm that almost always leads to your defeat.

gun-saint.name: Gun Saint
gun-saint.description: The bullet is not a projectile; it is an extension of my will. The Gun Saint has transcended marksmanship and entered the realm of ballistic artistry. They treat firearms with a quasi-religious reverence, capable of feats that defy physics and logic through a combination of Aetheric manipulation and impossible skill.

overwatch.name: Overwatch
overwatch.path: Sentinel -> Battle Saint -> Gun Saint -> Overwatch
overwatch.description: One shot, one kill. The Overwatch is the patient hunter, the master of the long-range engagement. They find a perch, become one with their rifle, and control the entire battlefield from a distance, delivering death from an unseen quarter.

gun-devil.name: Gun Devil
gun-devil.path: Sentinel -> Battle Saint -> Gun Saint -> Gun Devil
gun-devil.description: Punish the wicked. The Gun Devil is a dark reflection of the Prophet, driven not by a moral code to protect the innocent, but by a consuming need to punish the guilty. They are bounty hunters, executioners, and grim reapers who draw power from the very sins they seek to erase.

operator.name: Operator
operator.description: The Ghost in the Machine. The Operator moves beyond simple commands to form a direct, one-to-one attune to their creations. They do not just command their constructs; they become them, piloting them with the precision of their own bodies.

orb-weaver.name: Orb Weaver
orb-weaver.description: The Linked Swarm. The Orb Weaver has specialized in creating small, versatile, and interconnected constructs. They eschew a single, powerful servant in favor of a swarm of "orb" drones that function as a mobile security system, a distributed attack platform, and a multi-tool for infiltration.

dollmaker.name: Dollmaker
dollmaker.description: The Legion of One. The Dollmaker has moved beyond single constructs to command a small army of puppets. Their power is not in the strength of one servant, but in the coordinated action of many. They are a master conductor, and their puppets are the orchestra.

gremlins.name: Gremlins
gremlins.description: Chaos and Replication. Influenced by the chaotic whisper of The Worm, your constructs have become self-perpetuating, cannibalistic monstrosities. They are no longer your tools; you are merely the origin point for their infestation.

corpse-lord.name: Corpse Lord
corpse-lord.description: Flesh is the Ultimate Puppet. The Corpse Lord has turned their art of animation from inorganic matter to the far more pliable medium of the dead. They are not necromancers dealing with souls, but macabre puppeteers who see bodies as nothing more than marionettes waiting for a string.

champion.name: Champion
champion.description: Partnership is power. The Champion has chosen to align themselves with the spirits, acting as their agent, ally, and anchor in the physical world.

exorcist.name: Exorcist
exorcist.description: This world is for the living. The Exorcist sees rogue spirits and Wraiths not as beings to be negotiated with, but as infections to be contained and purged.

facilitator.name: Facilitator
facilitator.description: The broker of worlds. The Facilitator has built a reputation in the Aether. They are known as a reliable and effective bridge to the physical world, and spirits actively seek them out for the opportunity. Their power comes from their influence and the quality of the bargains they can strike.

herald.name: Herald
herald.description: I am the voice of my master. The Herald has sworn themself to the service of a single, immensely powerful Aetheric entity (a demigod, an arch-spirit, one of The Thirteen). They are no longer an independent broker; they are a prophet, a high priest, and the primary agent for their patron's will in the mortal world. This is a mutation born of devotion.

contractor.name: Contractor
contractor.description: The deal is the art. The Contractor is a master of supernatural law. They understand that the greatest power lies not in binding a spirit to a vessel for themselves, but in facilitating the binding agreements between spirits and mortals. They are sought-after arcane notaries, their trade being trust, knowledge, and the unshakeable power of a contract enforced by the timeless logic of the Aether.

broker.name: Broker
broker.description: The deal serves me. The Broker has moved beyond mere facilitation. They are now an active player, leveraging their contracts to gain power and influence within the Aether itself. Their deals are weighted, their bargains are sharp, and every contract signed is another step up the spiritual ladder, for good or for ill. This is a mutation born from ambition.

median.name: Median
median.description: The Median is a living conduit of biological Aether. Their power resonates with the patterns of life itself, allowing them to sense, influence, and mend the intricate biological processes of living beings. They are the doctors, the healers, and, at their most extreme, the architects of flesh.

splicer.name: Splicer
splicer.description: Flesh is mutable. The Gene-Splicer has moved beyond simple mending to become an architect of biological form. They understand the Aetheric pattern of life itself, allowing them to rewrite it.

waker.name: Waker
waker.description: Potential is a key to be turned. The Waker has mutated beyond merely shaping existing life. Their Aetheric Cortex has attuned to the very frequency of potential itself. They can sense the "Sparks" of latent Espers in the populace, and more terrifyingly, they can force that potential into being. They are the creators of new Espers, a power that makes them one of the most valuable and hunted beings in Sidonia.

amp.name: Amp
amp.description: Evolution needs a guiding hand. The Bio-Amp has moved beyond simple awakening. They can now see the branching evolutionary paths within another Esper's Aetheric Cortex and have learned to corrupt and force those paths to their will.

green-thumb.name: Green Thumb
green-thumb.description: The pulse of life is not limited to blood. The Green Thumb has attuned their Aetheric Cortex to the unique biological frequencies of the plant kingdom. They are gardeners, botanists, and masters of flora, able to sense the needs of plants and accelerate their growth with a touch.

green-smith.name: Green Smith
green-smith.description: Nature can be improved. The Green Smith is a master horticulturalist, a biological architect who doesn't just grow plants but actively designs them for greater utility, yield, and resilience.

blight-smith.name: Blight Smith
blight-smith.description: Survival at any cost. The Blight Smith has been exposed to and warped by the corrupting influence of the Blight. Instead of fighting it, they have embraced it, becoming a master of the twisted, toxic life that thrives in those poisoned lands. They are a corrupted echo of the Green Thumb's art.

beast-doctor.name: Beast Doctor
beast-doctor.description: Life is life, whether it walks on two legs or four. The Beast Doctor has attuned their healing abilities specifically to the non-human creatures of the world. They understand animal biology with an intuitive grace and can soothe the most savage beast with their calming presence.

researcher.name: Researcher
researcher.description: To understand is to protect. The Researcher has taken their love of animals and turned it into a scientific pursuit. They are dedicated to observing, cataloging, and understanding the strange and often dangerous fauna of Sidonia without interfering. They are the Jane Goodalls of a world filled with monsters.

weaver.name: Weaver
weaver.description: The Weaver perceives the world not as solid objects, but as an intricate tapestry of energy and patterns. They are living conduits, attuned to the flow of power, the geometry of space, and the subtle rhythms of reality. They do not force their will upon the world like a Sorcerer; instead, they gently pluck at the threads of existence to create their desired effect.

web-walker.name: Web Walker
web-walker.description: Space is not a barrier; it is a path. The Web Walker has focused their understanding of patterns onto the physical geometry of the world. They see the lines, the angles, and the connections that others miss, allowing them to traverse their environment with impossible grace and precision. They are the ultimate parkour artists and masters of positioning.

broadcaster.name: Broadcaster
broadcaster.description: The grid is my voice. The Broadcaster has learned to interface directly with Sidonia's unique, Forge-Crete-based power infrastructure. They don't just absorb electricity; they ride it, turning the city's own veins of power into their personal communication collective link.

flicker.name: Flicker
flicker.description: Reality is a suggestion. The Flicker has taken the Web Walker's understanding of geometry and applied it to their own physical form. They don't just navigate space; they treat it as a mutable, optional construct. They are a glitch in the world, a step ahead of reality, existing where they should be, not necessarily where they are.

heavy.name: Heavy
heavy.description: Gravity is a personal choice. The Heavy has focused their spatial manipulation inward, learning to control their own mass and gravitational pull. They are an immovable object and an unstoppable force, all depending on their whim.

boomer.name: Boomer
boomer.description: Space is a toy. The Boomer delights in small, localized, and often very loud manipulations of reality. They "yoink," "pop," and "bang" their way through problems, leaving chaos and confusion in their wake.

web-spinner.name: Web Spinner
web-spinner.description: The world is a story, and I have read ahead. The Web Spinner sees the patterns not in space, but in time and choice. They are masters of causality, seeing the threads of probability that connect actions to outcomes. They don't predict the future so much as they understand the present so perfectly that the future becomes obvious.

hex.name: Hex
hex.description: If misfortune exists, it should be directed. The Hex has learned to gather the ambient bad luck of the world and focus it into a targeted, personal curse. They don't create chaos; they weaponize it.

witness.name: Witness
witness.description: I am where I am meant to be. The Witness is a passive conduit for causality, guided by an unseen hand or an unconscious compulsion. They don't predict the future; they are simply delivered to the exact time and place where the future is being forged. They are the Zelig of Sidonia, fated to be present at every pivotal moment.

catalyst.name: Catalyst
catalyst.description: History is a story, and I am its author. The Catalyst has been tempted by the Wyrm, rejecting the passive role of an observer for the active role of a creator. They no longer just record history; they rewrite it, twisting events and narratives to serve a new, chaotic purpose.

oracle.name: Oracle
oracle.description: The future whispers, but rarely speaks clearly. The Oracle is attuned to the grand, sweeping patterns of causality. They do not see precise futures, but rather receive symbolic, metaphorical glimpses of what is to come. They are interpreters of omens, readers of cosmic tarot cards, trying to make sense of a future that is always in motion.

web-warper.name: Web Warper
web-warper.description: A perfect pattern is a boring pattern. The Web Warper has embraced dissonance, finding power and beauty in the corruption of pure systems. They are agents of chaos, not through random chance, but through the deliberate introduction of disharmonious frequencies into the weave of reality.

banshee.name: Banshee
banshee.description: Sound is the perfect weapon. The Banshee has focused their corrupting influence into their voice, turning it into an instrument capable of shattering both matter and flesh with pure, resonant frequency.

nightstalker.name: Nightstalker
nightstalker.description: The shadow is my home. The Nightstalker has learned to weave dissonance into light itself, creating pockets of unnatural darkness and making their own form indistinct and terrifying.

mage-eater.name: Mage Eater
mage-eater.description: Magic is a flaw to be corrected. The Mage Eater has specialized in hunting those who use the Aether. They are a living counter-spell, their very presence anathema to sorcery and enchantment.

linker.name: Linker
linker.description: The mind is a collective link. The Linker is the ultimate force multiplier, an Esper whose Aetheric Cortex functions like a biological wireless router. They do not excel in personal combat or overt power, but in their unparalleled ability to forge psychic connections between conscious minds. They are the strategists, the coordinators, and the heart of any effective team. A single Linker can turn five individuals into a single, cohesive, and terrifyingly efficient unit.

companion.name: Companion
companion.description: My bond is my strength. The Companion has dedicated themselves to the art of the two-way link. They seek to create a partnership so profound that the two linked individuals become more than the sum of their parts, sharing thoughts, emotions, and strengths in a seamless, synergistic union.

guardian.name: Guardian
guardian.description: I am your shield. This bond is not one of equals, but one of protection. One individual (the Guardian) takes on the role of protector, while the other (the Ward) benefits from that protection. This path awakens Aetheric protocols related to ancient bodyguard and sentinel pairings.

hub.name: Hub
hub.description: One mind, many bodies. The Hub has dedicated themself to mastering the complex art of the 5x5 link. They are the ultimate team captain, the central server through which all communication and coordination flows. Their power is measured by the flawless efficiency of the team they command.

coordinator.name: Coordinator
coordinator.description: The collective link is everything. The Coordinator focuses on the mastery of the link itself. They are masters of bond strength, range, and clarity of connection, ensuring their team stays connected and coordinated under any circumstances. They are the Ops Chief, the master of coordination.

booster.name: Booster
booster.description: The whole is greater than the sum of its parts. The Booster has moved beyond just maintaining the link; they now actively cultivate and manage the team's collective energy and knowledge. They are a living force multiplier, turning their team's shared experiences and skills into a tangible, powerful resource that everyone can draw upon.

relay.name: Relay
relay.description: Information is victory. The Relay has perfected the art of information transmission across their collective link. They are no longer just a switchboard operator; they are a high-speed, encrypted server, ensuring that the right information gets to the right person at the right time, with perfect clarity.

sin-eater.name: Sin Eater
sin-eater.description: The crowd is a single mind, and I am its shepherd. The Sin Eater has learned to create a wide, shallow psychic link with entire groups of people, tapping into their shared emotions to manipulate them on a grand scale. They are social parasites, feeding on and amplifying the mood of a crowd for their own ends.

orchestrator.name: Orchestrator
orchestrator.description: The team is my symphony. The Orchestrator does not just manage a collective link; they conduct it. They process information, anticipate actions, and direct their team with such precision that every movement is part of a grander design, turning a chaotic firefight into a perfectly synchronized tactical dance.

conductor.name: Conductor
conductor.description: I am the perfect strategy. The Conductor is the ultimate tactical genius, capable of assessing the capabilities of every team member and orchestrating a perfectly synchronized, devastating attack that ends a conflict with surgical precision.

crowd-surfer.name: Crowd Surfer
crowd-surfer.description: The mob is my puppet. The Crowd Surfer takes the Puppeteer's ability to control and scales it to a horrifying degree. They infiltrate groups, hijack their collective consciousness, and turn them into a malleable, weaponized "flash mob," dancing to their hidden tune.

animist.name: Animist
animist.description: All life is a collective link. The Animist attunes their mind not to the logic of humanity, but to the primal, instinctual consciousness of the animal kingdom. They are masters of non-human communication, capable of forging links with beasts, monsters, and even alien hive minds.

beast-breeder.name: Beast Breeder
beast-breeder.description: The pack is family. The Beast Breeder focuses on raising, managing, and understanding entire groups of animals. They are the alpha, the zookeeper, and the master of pack dynamics.

beast-tamer.name: Beast Tamer
beast-tamer.description: Every beast has a soul. The Beast Tamer focuses on forming a deep, empathetic bond with individual creatures. They are the rehabilitators, the whisperers, the ones who can soothe the savage heart.
